abstract.p: D J McConville letter on Frances Frank Marcus's October 22 article on tropical travel bargains notes Puerto Rico's Gallery Inn lacks elevator and has steep stairs; Marcus responds (S)

block.p: To the Editor: In reference to ''Bargains Under Tropical Skies,'' (Oct. 22) by Frances Frank Marcus, as an experienced traveler in Puerto Rico, I was appalled at your selection of the Gallery Inn. It is hardly an inn -- but rather a guest house with no elevator and very steep stairs.

To the Editor: In reference to ''Bargains Under Tropical Skies,'' (Oct. 22) by Frances Frank Marcus, as an experienced traveler in Puerto Rico, I was appalled at your selection of the Gallery Inn. It is hardly an inn -- but rather a guest house with no elevator and very steep stairs.
It may overlook the sea, but if you don't have a car (and using one in the narrow streets of Old San Juan is ludicrous), you better be in great condition to walk up and down steep hills to get meals.
D. J. McCONVILLE New York, N.Y.

Frances Frank Marcus responds: Many of the Caribbean's smaller hotels and inns lack elevators. And I agree that Old San Juan is no place to drive a car. But one of the pleasures of staying in the old city is to walk through the narrow streets. I toured Gallery Inn from cellar to rooftop and found it a charming, comfortable, art-filled base for seeing the city.
